title: Circular economy: the rule of the three R's... or seven? - CEPSA.com
summary: The circular economy model aims to reduce waste and resource consumption by reusing and recycling materials. Unlike the linear model of take, make, dispose, the circular economy strives to extend the life of products and use waste as raw material. This model involves minimizing the use of raw materials, water, and energy while promoting eco-design, repair, renewal, and waste recovery.

title: The extent to which circular economy principles have been applied in the design of medical devices for low-resource ... - Frontiers
summary: This article investigates the extent to which circular economy (CE) principles have been applied in the design of medical devices for low-resource settings in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA).  A systematic review of 29 scientific papers reveals that CE principles like durability, repair, maintenance, and upgrade are commonly used to ensure medical devices last longer in LRS, but principles for refurbishment, remanufacturing, and recycling are largely absent. The study highlights the need for research into these areas to prevent premature disposal of medical devices and promote sustainable healthcare in SSA.

title: The circular cement value chain: Decarbonizing cement - McKinsey

title: Revisiting Circular Economy in 2023 - United Nations Development Programme
summary: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) in Fiji is working to reduce plastic pollution by promoting circular economy practices.  This includes initiatives like collecting post-consumer plastic waste and repurposing it into new products, creating awareness and educational programs, and encouraging the use of circular economy strategies in town council functions. This effort is driven by the need to protect Fiji's marine environment and economy from the detrimental effects of plastic pollution.

title: Sustainable food industry solutions for the future - The Washington Post

title: BINGO focus on alternative fuel - Waste Management Review
summary: BINGO Industries is implementing a new green technology that will help divert residual waste from landfills and produce Refuse Derived Fuel (RDF). The company is collaborating with FOCUS Enviro and utilizing an UNTHA XR3000C shredding system to achieve a higher recovery rate and produce RDF that can be used as a substitute for coal in various industries. This initiative is driven by the increasing demand for sustainable solutions and aims to further BINGO's commitment to a circular economy.

title: How damaged, discontinued and returned goods are being saved from landfill - Nine Shows
summary: Circonomy, a social enterprise in Melbourne and Brisbane, is tackling waste by rescuing unsold or damaged goods from retailers and selling them at discounted prices. The company works with major brands like Catch, David Jones, and Officeworks, refurbishing items that would otherwise end up in landfills and offering them to consumers at up to 70% off. This initiative aims to promote a circular economy, reduce waste, and provide affordable goods to the community.
